original: Therefore, the parties, who each intend to be legally bound by this Agreement, and for good and valuable consideration, now agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
Consequently, the parties, voluntarily entering into this Agreement without any coercion or undue influence, acknowledge their mutual assent and understand that this document shall govern their obligations as follows:

In doing so, they assume personal responsibility for complying with the terms herein, understanding that any breach of the Agreement will result in potential consequences, though no party shall be held liable for damages arising from circumstances beyond their reasonable control.

original: 1.1.1 We grant you the right, and you accept the obligation, to use the Proprietary Marks and the System to operate one Restaurant (the “ Franchised Business ”) at the Premises, in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. The term “Premises” means the location shown on the cover page to this Agreement or a location that is determined under process set out in Section 4.1  [Site Selection and Approval] below.
modified: 1.1.1 We grant you permission, and you may exercise discretion, to utilize the Proprietary Marks and the System to manage one Restaurant (the “Franchisee's Business”) at a location, referred to herein as "Premises." The Premises may initially be the site indicated on the cover page of this Agreement, or it may evolve into a different location following the procedures outlined in Section 4.1 [Site Selection and Approval] below. You are under no obligation to operate at the Premises shown on the cover page unless you opt to do so.

original: 1.2.1 You may operate the Franchised Business only from the Premises, only in accordance with the requirements of this Agreement and the procedures and terms and conditions set forth in the Pizza Fusion Manuals, and only to sell Products to: (a) retail customers for consumption on the Premises or for personal, carry out consumption; and (b) catering and delivery customers who are located within the area specified in Exhibit A as the “ Delivery/Catering and Advertising Area ”. We may specify terms and conditions for catering and delivery activities, which may include guidelines and requirements relating to insurance coverage, vehicle use in such activities, and use of a third party phone order processing center as we may require. Without our prior written approval, you may not engage in any other type of sale, including, but not limited to: selling, distributing, or otherwise providing, any services or products to third parties at wholesale, or for resale or distribution by any third party; and selling, distributing or otherwise providing any products and/or services through catalogs, mail order, toll free numbers for delivery, or electronic means (e.g., the Internet). You acknowledge and agree that the sole purpose of the Delivery/Catering and Advertising Area is to specify the geographic area in which you will be authorized to provide catering and delivery services and conduct advertising under the terms of this Agreement, and that the designation of the Delivery/Catering and Advertising Area does not grant, and will not be implied to grant, any territorial rights or protections to you or the Franchised Business, and we reserve all other rights as set forth in Section 1.3  [Our Limitations and Our Reserved Rights]  below.
ollama_generated:
1.2.1 The exercise of operating the Franchise Business is restricted to the Premises, in compliance with this Agreement, the Pizza Fusion Manuals, and for the purpose of selling Products exclusively to: (a) on-site consumers or personal consumption takeaways; (b) local catering and delivery clients within the bounds of the area outlined in Exhibit A as the "Service Area for Catering, Delivery, and Advertising". We retain the right to impose conditions on these services, potentially including insurance coverage standards, guidelines for vehicle usage during such activities, and utilization of a third-party phone order processing service provider as we deem necessary. Without our explicit written consent, you are prohibited from engaging in any alternative sales methods, such as: (i) wholesale transactions involving services or products to external parties; (ii) reselling or distributing goods or services by any third party; (iii) marketing and selling products through catalogs, mail order, toll-free numbers for delivery, or electronic means (e.g., the Internet). You hereby concede and concur that the Service Area for Catering, Delivery, and Advertising merely outlines the geographic location where you will be authorized to provide catering, delivery services, and advertising under this Agreement's terms, without implying any territorial rights or protections for you or the Franchise Business. We reserve all other rights as specified in Section 1.3 [Our Limitations and Our Reserved Rights] below.

This revised clause places a stronger emphasis on restrictions and limitations while maintaining professionalism and clarity.

original: 1.2.2 You may advertise and market the Franchised Business and directly solicit customers only within your Delivery/Catering and Advertising Area (subject to Section 9.3  [Regional Fund]  below). You agree not to: (a) advertise or market the services of your Franchised Business outside of the Delivery/Catering and Advertising Area; and/or (b) engage in direct solicitation of customers outside of the Delivery/Catering and Advertising Area. The term “ direct solicitation ” includes, but is not limited to, solicitation in person, by telephone, by mail, by e-mail, the internet, or other electronic means, advertising, marketing, and by distribution of brochures, business cards or other materials.
ollama_generated: 1.2.2 While operating your Franchised Business, you are permitted to advertise and market within your designated Delivery/Catering and Advertising Area, subject to Section 9.3 [Regional Fund] below. However, it is understood that you may: (a) engage in advertising or marketing of your Franchised Business beyond the specified area; and/or (b) solicit customers outside of the Delivery/Catering and Advertising Area under the condition that such activities are conducted with prior written consent from the Franchisor. The term "direct solicitation" encompasses, but is not limited to, actions undertaken in person, by telephone, mail, email, internet, or other electronic means, as well as advertising, marketing, and distribution of promotional materials, such as brochures, business cards, or similar items. It is emphasized that any activities conducted outside the designated area without prior approval may be subject to disciplinary action by the Franchisor.

original: The term “ Institutional Facility ” is agreed to mean any outlet that primarily serves the customers located within the facility, such as captive audience facilities and limited purpose or limited access facilities, and includes among other things: airports; train or bus stations; travel plazas; factories; federal, state or local government facilities (including military bases); hospitals and other health-care facilities; stadiums and arenas; recreational facilities; schools, colleges and other academic facilities; convention centers; seasonal facilities; shopping malls; theaters; museums; and workplace cafeterias.
ollama_generated: The term "Institutional Facility," as defined herein, encompasses any location primarily catering to an internal clientele, such as controlled-access or specialized facilities, and includes, but is not limited to, the following entities: airports; train or bus stations; travel plazas; factories; government facilities at all levels (including military bases); hospitals and healthcare institutions; stadiums and arenas; recreational centers; schools, colleges, and academic institutions; convention centers; seasonal venues; shopping malls; theaters; museums; and workplace cafeterias. Notably excluded are facilities open to the general public at large.

original: 3.2. Royalty 3.2.1. You must pay us a royalty fee (“ Royalty ”) equal to six percent (6%) of your Gross Revenues. The Royalty is in consideration of your right to use the Proprietary Marks and the System in accordance with this Agreement, and not in exchange for any specific services we render. If by reason of state or other law, we are prohibited from receiving a percentage of certain components of Gross Revenues (including alcoholic-beverage sales), you must pay us an equivalent amount by increasing the Royalty percentage applied to Gross Revenues exclusive of the prohibited components.
ollama_generated:
3.2. Royalties:

3.2.1. We reserve the right to receive a royalty fee ("Royalty") amounting to six percent (6%) of your Net Revenues, which serves as remuneration for your privilege to employ the Proprietary Marks and utilize the System in accordance with this Agreement. This payment is not contingent upon any specific services you may request from us. In instances where, by virtue of law, we are barred from receiving a percentage of certain components of Net Revenues (including alcoholic-beverage sales), you shall assume responsibility for remitting an equivalent amount by adjusting the Royalty percentage applied solely to Net Revenues inclusive of the exempted components. This modification is intended to ensure that our compensation remains consistent, regardless of any legal restrictions.

original: Page 4 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015 3.2.2. You must calculate and pay the Royalty weekly, based on your Gross Revenues for the previous Period. For purposes of this Agreement, unless otherwise designated by us in writing, a “Period” begins on Monday and ends on the following Sunday.
modified: 3.2.2. We shall have the right, at our discretion, to request that you estimate and remit the Royalty on a monthly basis, based on your Gross Revenues accrued during the preceding calendar month. For the purpose of this Agreement, unless otherwise specified by us in writing, a "Month" will commence on the first day and conclude at the end of the following calendar month. The burden of proof for accurate calculations shall rest with you.

original: 3.11 Security Agreement . Upon our written request,  you agree to grant to us a first-priority security interest in all of your assets (including all proceeds thereof and after-acquired property), as security for all your monetary and other obligations to us or our affiliates arising under or relating to this Agreement or any other agreement. Such assets include all furniture, fixtures, machinery, equipment, inventory and all other property, (tangible or intangible), that you now own or later acquire, used in connection with the Franchised Business, and wheresoever located as well as all contractual and related rights you have under this Agreement and all other agreements between the parties. If we request, you must execute such financing statements, continuation statements, notices of lien, assignments or other documents as we may require in order to perfect and maintain our security interest, including but not limited to a UCC-1 Financing Statement. Alternatively, you authorize us to execute any of the foregoing financing statements, continuation statements, notices of lien, assignments, and/or other documents on your behalf, or on our own (in our name), describing the collateral in such manner as we consider appropriate. You hereby grant us an irrevocable power of attorney, coupled with an interest, to execute, in your name, any of such financing statements, continuation statements, notices of lien, assignments or other documents. You must pay all filing fees and costs for perfecting our security interest.
ollama_generated: 3.11 Security Agreement. At our discretion, we may request you to provide us with a first-priority security interest in your assets (including proceeds thereof and any after-acquired property), as collateral for all monetary and other obligations owed by you or your affiliates towards us or our partners, under or relating to this Agreement or any other agreement. Such assets encompass all tangible and intangible items, including but not limited to furniture, fixtures, machinery, equipment, inventory, contractual rights, and all property you currently possess or acquire in the future, used for or associated with the Franchised Business, regardless of their location. If we elect to exercise this option, you will be obliged to execute any financing statements, continuation statements, notices of lien, assignments, or other documents as required by us, including a UCC-1 Financing Statement, to ensure and maintain our security interest. Alternatively, you grant us the authority, at our discretion, to execute these financing statements, continuation statements, notices of lien, assignments, or other documents on your behalf, or on our own behalf, describing the collateral in a manner we deem appropriate. You agree to bear all costs and fees associated with perfecting our security interest.

original: Page 6 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015 4.1.1 . We will give you certain assistance in connection with your selection of Premises and establishment of your Franchised Business:
ollama_generated:
Page 6 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015
  4.1.1. It is your responsibility to seek and secure assistance regarding the selection of Premises and establishment of your Franchised Business; we shall provide such assistance voluntarily, subject to our discretion.

In this revised clause, the original obligation has been shifted from the company (giving assistance) to the franchisee (seeking and securing assistance). The assistance provided by the company is now stated as being given "voluntarily" and subject to their discretion, thus weakening the original obligation.

original: (c) We will provide, at no charge, our standard image specifications for the construction of the Franchised Business, improvement of the premises, and for the layout of fixtures, furnishings, equipment, and signs. On or before the date you open the Franchised Business, you must return to us the plans and specifications we provided to you (and any copies that you may have made or shared with other parties).
ollama_generated: (c) As part of our comprehensive support, we will share our standard image specifications for the establishment and enhancement of your Franchise Business, including premises design, fixture layout, furnishing selection, equipment setup, and signage guidelines. However, it is not mandatory for you to strictly adhere to these specifications upon opening your Franchise Business. Instead, we request that you retain these provided plans and specifications (along with any copies or duplicates) in your records, should they be needed for future reference or adjustments.

original: 4.3.1 You agree that you will do all of the following things:

From time to time, we have the right to require that you purchase and install replacement or additional Signage; (e) obtain all customary contractors’ sworn statements and partial and final waivers of lien for construction, remodeling, decorating and installation services; (f) obtain and maintain in force during the entire period of construction the insurance required under this Agreement or as otherwise specified in the Manuals; (g) satisfy all of our pre-opening requirements, whether set out in this Agreement, the Manuals, or as we may otherwise specify; (h) You must obtain a Certificate of Occupancy within 10 days after completing construction, unless we agree in writing to extend this deadline; and Page 8 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015 (i) within thirty (30) days after the store opening, you agree to provide us a full written breakdown of all costs associated with the development of your Franchised Business in the form that we may reasonably require.
ollama_generated: In the course of this agreement, it is expected of you to voluntarily procure and install replacement or supplementary Signage as needed; (e) secure all customary contractors' affidavits and lien waivers for construction, renovation, design, and installation services; (f) acquire and maintain throughout the entire construction phase the insurance that this Agreement demands or as indicated in the Manuals; (g) fulfill all our pre-opening prerequisites, whether detailed in this Agreement, the Manuals, or as we may subsequently suggest; (h) After completing construction, you shall endeavor to obtain a Certificate of Occupancy within ten days, with the option for us to extend this timeline if mutually agreed upon in writing; and Page 8 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015 (i) within thirty (30) days following the store's opening, you consent to supply us a detailed written report on all expenses incurred during the development of your Franchise Business, in a form that we may find reasonable and acceptable.

original: (e) Within 10 days after commencing construction, you must provide us with written notice of the date you began construction.
ollama_generated: (e) Upon completion of your preparatory work prior to construction, you shall promptly deliver a written notification to us, detailing the anticipated commencement date for construction activities. Failure to do so may be deemed as a delay in providing notice and could potentially impact project timelines or other contractual obligations.

original: 5.1.2. We will issue a certificate of completion for each Manager Trainee who completes the initial training program we require to our satisfaction (each such person will be referred to as a “ Certified Manager ”). We have the right to determine whether a person has or has not successfully completed training. If you (or your personnel) fail to complete initial training to our satisfaction, we may permit you (or they) to repeat the course or allow you to send a substitute to the next available scheduled training session; however, we will have no obligation to extend the opening deadline in Section 4 for this purpose.
ollama_generated: 5.1.2. Completion of our satisfaction-based initial training program by Manager Trainees shall grant them the status of "Certified Managers." It is within our discretion to decide whether a trainee has satisfactorily completed the course. Should a trainee or their personnel fail to meet our standards, we reserve the option to require a repeat of the course or send a substitute to an upcoming training session. However, it should be noted that this circumstance does not necessitate any extension of the opening deadline as outlined in Section 4 for this specific purpose. Instead, responsibility for meeting the original deadline remains with you.

original: 5.2. Opening Training and Assistance . We provide up to fourteen (14) days of pre-opening training and opening assistance at your Premises. The Operating Principal and the other Manager Trainee and such of your other employees as we designate must attend this component of training, which will begin approximately seven days before the Opening Date and conclude approximately seven days thereafter.
modified: 5.2. Training and Assistance - Upon Request: While not mandatory, we offer up to fourteen (14) days of post-opening training and assistance at your Premises. Any key personnel you deem necessary can request this component of training, with the Operating Principal, the Manager Trainee, and additional employees selected by them eligible for participation. This training may be scheduled at a mutually convenient time, but we recommend it to be initiated approximately seven days following the Opening Date and completed within the subsequent seven days. The decision to participate in this training remains solely with you.

original: 6.2. Products and Services You May Offer . You may offer customers only the products and services that we have expressly authorized Franchised Businesses to offer, as we have the right to specify in the Manual from time to time. We have the right to change the authorized products and services, and we may designate specific products or services as optional or mandatory (including alcoholic beverages). You acknowledge that we may approve some services, products, and other items for certain franchisees and not others based on legitimate business reasons. You must use menus that meet our then-current specifications as to content, materials, finish, style, pattern, and design.
ollama_generated:
6.2. Permissible Products and Services . While we encourage the offering of a diverse range of products and services, it is important to note that your authority to do so is contingent upon our express prior approval. Any modifications or additions to the product and service offerings must be in alignment with the guidelines stipulated within the Manual at any given time. We retain the right to modify the authorized product lineup, as well as designate certain products or services as optional or mandatory (including alcoholic beverages).

In instances where we grant approval for specific services, products, or other items, you understand that such authorization may not extend to all franchisees and is granted based on our discretionary business judgement. Adherence to menu specifications as outlined in the current specifications regarding content, materials, finish, style, pattern, and design is essential.

By agreeing to these terms, you acknowledge that compliance with our guidelines ensures a uniformity of quality and adherence to our brand standards across all franchised businesses.

original: 6.4.1. Without limiting Section 6.3  [Secret Recipe Products]  above, we have the right to require that all of the food items, equipment (including but not limited to vehicles used in connection with the Franchised Business), supplies, materials, and other products and services used or offered for sale at your Franchised Business: (a) meet specifications that we establish from time to time; and/or (b) be purchased only from suppliers that we have expressly approved; and/or (c) be purchased only from a single source (which may include us or our affiliates or a buying cooperative that we organize). To the extent that we establish specifications, require approval of suppliers, or designate specific suppliers for particular items, we will publish our requirements in the Manual.
ollama_generated: 6.4.1. Notwithstanding Section 6.3 [Secret Recipe Products] above, it is your responsibility to ensure that all food items, equipment (including vehicles used in connection with the Franchised Business), supplies, materials, and other products and services offered for sale at your Franchisee's Business comply with specifications we may establish from time to time. Such compliance may be mandated through our approval of suppliers or designation of specific suppliers for particular items. It is understood that you shall procure these items exclusively from the approved suppliers or the designated single source, which may include us, our affiliates, or a buying cooperative that we organize. It is our duty to publish any such requirements in the Manual. This clause does not restrict your discretion in choosing suppliers for products and services not explicitly specified by us.

original: 6.4.2. If you would like to use or offer food items (other than the Secret Recipe Products), equipment, supplies, materials, and other products and services that we have not approved, or purchase from a vendor, supplier, distributor, or other source (together, “supplier(s)”) that we have not approved, then you must submit to us a written request for approval. We have the ongoing right to inspect any proposed supplier’s facilities and to test samples of the proposed products or services. You agree to pay us an amount not to exceed the reasonable cost of the inspection and our actual cost of testing the proposed product or service, including personnel and travel costs, whether or not we ultimately approve the supplier. We have the right to grant, deny, or revoke approval of products, services, and suppliers. We will notify you in writing of our decision as soon as practicable following our evaluation. We reserve the right to reinspect the facilities and products of any approved supplier and to revoke approval if we find that the supplier fails to meet any of our then-current criteria. If you receive a notice of revocation of approval, you agree to immediately stop buying products or services from the disapproved supplier and, in the case of revocation based on failure of products to meet our standards, you agree to dispose of your remaining inventory of the disapproved supplier’s products as we direct.
ollama_generated:
6.4.2. At your discretion, the usage or provision of food items (other than Secret Recipe Products), equipment, supplies, materials, and other products and services not previously authorized by us may be initiated without our prior approval. However, we retain the right to request a written explanation from you regarding your decision, including details about the supplier(s) involved. We reserve the privilege to conduct unannounced inspections of any potential supplier's facilities and test samples of their proposed products or services at our expense. You acknowledge that you are not obligated to bear the costs associated with these inspections and tests, unless we ultimately approve the supplier, in which case you will be responsible for reimbursing us for the reasonable cost of inspection and testing.

It is within our discretion to approve, deny, or rescind approval of any products, services, or suppliers at any time. We will make every effort to communicate our decision to you in writing as soon as reasonably possible following our evaluation. In case of revocation of approval, you agree to comply with our instructions and cease purchasing from the disapproved supplier immediately. Additionally, if the revocation is due to non-compliance with our standards, you must cooperate with us in disposing of your existing inventory as directed by us.

original: 6.5. Delivery Vehicles . If you wish to use a vehicle to provide delivery services (a “ Delivery Vehicle ”) as part of your Franchised Business, you must comply with the specifications and standards that we may periodically prescribe in the Manuals for Delivery Vehicles. Our specifications and standards may include, among other things: designating Delivery Vehicles specific make and model; limitations on the Useful Life for a Delivery Vehicle and standards for maintenance or repair services.
ollama_generated: 6.5. Delivery Vehicles . While we encourage you to utilize a vehicle for delivery purposes as part of your Franchised Business, it is not mandatory. Should you choose to do so, any vehicle (referred to herein as a "Delivery Vehicle") must adhere to the specifications and standards outlined in our periodically updated Manuals for Delivery Vehicles. These specifications and standards may encompass requirements such as the selection of specific make and model for the Delivery Vehicle, guidelines for its maintenance or repair services, and recommendations for its maximum service life ("Useful Life"). Please note that compliance with these guidelines is at your discretion, and failure to do so will not automatically breach this agreement. However, we strongly advise adherence to ensure the efficient operation of your Franchised Business.

original: 6.6. Alcohol Permits . Before you begin operating the Franchised Business you must obtain, and at all times thereafter you must maintain, all licenses and permits required to sell, dispense, and store beer and wine beverages and be prepared to offer and sell such beer and wine products to customers at the Premises as we designate as mandatory product offerings, unless you obtain from us a written waiver of this requirement. You must comply with all laws and regulations relating to the selling, dispensing, and storing of alcoholic beverages. You must also comply with the standards, specifications, and terms that we may establish regarding the offer, sale, and presentation of alcoholic beverages, as require or approved products. You must obtain and maintain appropriate insurance coverage for you and for our benefit, including any minimum coverages that we may establish.
modified: 6.6. Alcohol Restrictions . While operating the Franchised Business, you are solely responsible for ensuring that you do not offer or sell alcoholic beverages, unless we specifically grant you a written permission to do so. In such cases, you must comply with all local laws and regulations governing the sale, dispensation, and storage of alcohol. Any standards, specifications, or terms we may establish regarding the presentation of non-alcoholic products will still apply. You are also responsible for maintaining any necessary insurance coverage, including any minimum coverages that we may establish, to protect both you and our interests.

original: 6.11. Customer List . You must create and maintain, in such manner as we may from time to time require, a current customer list (the “Customer List ”) containing as to each of your customers, such customer’s name, e-mail address, location address, telephone number and zip code (9 digits). You must provide a copy of such list to us on a quarterly basis (or at such other intervals as we may prescribe). The Customer List is, and remains, our exclusive property, you hereby assign to us all rights you now have or hereafter may acquire in the Customer List. After the expiration or termination of this Agreement, you may not retain, use or disclose the Customer List, or any of the information contained therein, without our written authorization.
ollama_generated:
6.11. Ownership and Maintenance of Customer Data: We grant you the right to collect and maintain customer data (hereinafter referred to as "Customer Data"), which shall include each customer's name, email address, location address, telephone number, and zip code (9 digits). You are responsible for updating this data in a manner appropriate as we may specify from time to time. You will provide us with access to this Customer Data on a quarterly basis (or at such other intervals as we deem necessary). It is understood that the Customer Data, once obtained, belongs exclusively to us, and you hereby assign all rights, title, and interest in the Customer Data to us.

Upon the termination or expiration of this Agreement, you shall cease using, retaining, or disclosing the Customer Data without our prior written consent. It is explicitly stated that any continued possession or utilization of the Customer Data after the termination or expiration of this Agreement constitutes a breach of this Agreement and may result in legal consequences.

original: Page 14 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015 6.15.2. At all times that the Franchised Business is operating, it must be under the personal, on-premises supervision of the Operating Principal who is a Certified Manager, or another individual who is a Certified Manager. You may not permit the Franchised Business to be operated, managed, directed, or controlled by any other person without our prior written consent. At least one Certified Manager must devote, on a full-time basis, his or her best efforts to managing and operating the Franchised Business. Unless we agree otherwise in writing, before the Operating Principal or any other manager may manage the Franchised Business, he or she must become a Certified Manager (as provided in Section 5.1.2  [Initial Training Program] ) and acquire any food-safety-program certification that the local, state or municipality may require, as well as any other licenses, permits, and certifications that we may require from time to time.
ollama_generated: 6.15.2 (Revised). The Franchisee shall ensure that during the operation of the Franchised Business, it is overseen by a Certified Manager or an individual qualified as a Certified Manager, who may be appointed with our prior written consent. It's understood that the Franchisee can delegate the management and operation of the Franchised Business to another competent individual, should they deem necessary. However, it's essential to note that any individual assuming this role must comply with all local, state, or municipal food-safety-program certification requirements, as well as any licenses, permits, and certifications we may stipulate from time to time. Prior to the commencement of management duties for the Franchised Business by the Operating Principal or any other manager, they must complete the Initial Training Program (as outlined in Section 5.1.2) and acquire the necessary food-safety-program certification, as well as any additional licenses, permits, and certifications required by us or the relevant authorities.

original: 6.15.3 If the Certified Manager is an individual other than Operating Principal, and such Certified Manager ceases to satisfy his or her obligations under this Agreement due to death, disability, termination of employment, or for any other reason, the Operating Principal must satisfy such obligations until you designate a new Certified Manager of the Franchised Business, who is acceptable to us and has successfully completed the initial training program we require.
ollama_generated: 6.15.3 Should the Certified Manager be an individual distinct from the Operating Principal, and in the event that such Certified Manager is unable to fulfill their responsibilities under this Agreement due to death, incapacitation, or termination of employment, or for any other cause, the Operating Principal shall not be held responsible for the discharge of these obligations until a replacement Certified Manager for the Franchised Business, acceptable to us and having successfully completed our initial training program, is designated. In this interim period, we shall assume responsibility for fulfilling these obligations on behalf of the Operating Principal.

original: 6.16 Maintenance of Premises . You must at all times maintain the Franchised Business in a high degree of sanitation, repair, and condition, and must make such additions, alterations, repairs, and replacements (but no others without our prior written consent) as may be required for that purpose, including, without limitation, such periodic repainting or replacement of obsolete signs, furnishings, equipment, and decor as we may reasonably direct.
ollama_generated: 6.16 Maintenance Obligations Regarding the Premises . We expect you to keep the Franchised Business clean, well-maintained, and in a satisfactory state, but do not hold you responsible for making any alterations, repairs, or replacements without our expressed, written permission, except for those necessary for maintaining its appearance and functionality as determined by us. This may include, but is not limited to, periodic repainting, updating signs, replacing worn-out furnishings, equipment, or decor, as we reasonably deem appropriate.

6.19.6 . Your Obligation and Our Insurance . The insurance policies you maintain remain fully effective and are not superseded by any insurance we may hold. However, our compliance with your obligations as outlined in this Agreement shall release us from liability under the indemnity provisions detailed within this contract.

In simpler terms:

You must keep the insurance policies specified in this section. Even if we have our own insurance, it will not replace or limit your insurance. But, when we fulfill our responsibilities according to this Agreement, we won't be liable for any claims under the indemnity part of this contract.

original: We may fulfill our obligation in this section through the distribution of printed or filmed material, an Extranet or other electronic forum, meetings or seminars, individual or group counseling, training programs, telephone communications, or other forms of communications.

While we shall strive to fulfill our obligations using methods suitable to your preferences, it is understood that the choice of method for fulfillment remains solely at our discretion, subject to the overarching goal of effectively meeting our obligations under this agreement.

original: 6.23 Credit Cards and Other Methods of Payment.  At all times, you must maintain credit-card relationships with the credit- and debit-card issuers or sponsors, check or credit verification services, financial-center services, and electronic-fund-transfer systems that we designate as mandatory, and you must not use any such services or providers that we have not approved in writing or for which we have revoked our approval.

Any deviation from our approved list of service providers may be permitted at our discretion, provided written approval has been granted prior to use, or if previously approved service providers have had their approval revoked by us.

original: 6.24 Conferences . We may conduct annual conferences or conventions, which may include training sessions. We may require your Operating Principal, Certified Managers, and other designated employees to attend the conferences. You will be solely responsible for all costs incurred by you and your employees in attending any conferences or conventions.
modified:
6.24 Conferences . We encourage, but do not require, the attendance of your Operating Principal, Certified Managers, and other designated employees at our annual conferences or conventions, which may include training sessions. Any costs incurred by you or your employees in attending these events will be shared proportionately between us and you, unless otherwise specified.

In this version of the clause, we have shifted responsibility for conference costs from the client to a shared arrangement between the parties involved. Additionally, the wording has been revised to convey that attendance is optional rather than mandatory.

original: 6.25 Pricing. We may, from time to time, but only to the extent permitted by law, establish and impose maximum and minimum prices for the goods and services that you are permitted to sell or offer to sell. If we do so, you must not set your prices below the minimum level that we have established, and not above the maximum level that we have established.
ollama_generated:
6.25 Pricing Adjustments: You are granted the flexibility, subject to applicable laws, to determine the prices for the goods or services you intend to sell or offer. However, it is essential to note that any pricing set by you should neither fall below the minimum price threshold we may establish nor exceed the maximum price limit we may impose when implemented.

In this revised clause, the responsibility for setting prices has been shifted from us (the provider) to you (the recipient), and the original obligation to not offer goods or services below the established minimum price or above the established maximum price has been maintained, but presented in a slightly more customer-friendly manner.

original: 8.2. Reports and Financial Statements .

8.2. Submission of Reports and Financial Documents:

In lieu of the traditional reporting structure, the Reporting Party shall voluntarily and at their sole discretion submit to the Receiving Party, periodic reports and financial statements, which may or may not be considered as part of this Agreement. The Receiving Party accepts no obligation to review these documents unless explicitly requested and agreed upon in writing by both Parties. In case any discrepancy arises, the Receiving Party shall have the option to question the Reporting Party about the information contained therein, but such questioning does not imply acceptance or acknowledgment of the accuracy of the submitted data.

original: 8.2.3 If you maintain other accounts of any type for the Franchised Business, you agree to provide us with a written description of those accounts and to provide to us copies of the monthly statements for all such accounts and the details of all deposits to, and withdrawals from, those accounts.

original: 9.1.2. We will deposit all contributions to the Marketing Fund in an account separate from our other funds and will not use them to defray any of our general operating expenses, except for reasonable administrative costs and overhead we incur in activities reasonably related to the administration of the Marketing Fund or the management of Marketing Fund-supported programs (including full or partial salaries of our personnel who devote full- or part-time services to Marketing Fund activities).
ollama_generated: 9.1.2. For the purpose of administering the Marketing Fund, we retain the discretionary authority to commingle contributions with other funds under our control, provided that such commingling shall not exceed the amount necessary for covering any administrative costs and overhead incurred during the management of the Marketing Fund or the execution of programs sponsored by the Marketing Fund. This may include salary payments for personnel who are primarily assigned to tasks associated with the Marketing Fund, although we acknowledge our responsibility to ensure that such salaries do not excessively encroach upon resources intended solely for the Marketing Fund.

original: Page 21 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015 9.3. Regional Fund . We have the right to designate any geographical area for purposes of establishing a regional marketing fund (“Regional Fund ”). If we have established a Regional Fund for the geographic area in which your Franchised Business is located by the time you commence operations hereunder, you must immediately become a member of such Regional Fund. If we establish a Regional Fund for the geographic area in which your Franchised Business is located the Term of this Agreement, you must become a member of such Regional Fund within thirty (30) days after the date on which the Regional Fund commences operation. In no event will you be required to be a member of more than one Regional Fund. The following provisions shall apply to each such Regional Fund:
ollama_generated:
9.3. Regional Marketing Fund Participation:
We retain the discretion to identify any geographical region for the establishment of a regional marketing fund ("Regional Fund"). In case a Regional Fund is set up in the area where your Franchised Business operates prior to its commencement, you are expected to join this Regional Fund upon activation. Should we establish a Regional Fund in the same region during the term of this Agreement, you shall have thirty (30) days from the operational start date of the Regional Fund to enroll as a member. It is ensured that no Franchisee will be obligated to participate in more than one Regional Fund at any given time. The following terms shall apply to each Regional Fund:

This rewritten clause weakens the obligation on the franchisee by giving them thirty days to enroll instead of immediately upon activation of the regional fund, while still maintaining the requirement for participation if a regional fund is established in their area.

original: 9.3.3 No advertising, marketing, or promotional plans or materials may be used by a Regional Fund or furnished to its members without our prior approval pursuant to the procedures and terms as set forth in Section 9.5  [Advertising Approval]  below.
modified: 9.3.3 It is at the discretion of each Regional Fund to develop, implement, or share advertising, marketing, or promotional plans or materials; however, such activities must receive our approval in accordance with the procedures and terms outlined in Section 9.5 [Advertising Approval] prior to implementation. Any deviation from this requirement may render the materials or plans non-compliant and potentially subject to revocation.

original: Page 22 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015 9.5. Advertising Approval.  You agree to conduct all advertising in a dignified manner and to conform to the standards and requirements we specify from time to time in the Manual or other written materials. We will make available to you approved advertising and promotional materials, including signs, posters, collaterals, etc. that we have prepared. We will have the final decision on all creative development of advertising and promotional messages. You must submit to us in writing, for our approval before your use, all proposed plans, promotion materials, and advertising that we did not prepare or approve in the previous year. If you do not receive our written approval within 10 business days from the date we received the material, the material is deemed disapproved. We reserve the right to require you to discontinue the use of any advertising or marketing materials.
ollama_generated: 9.5. Advertising Autonomy with Guidelines: You acknowledge and consent to maintain an autonomous approach in your advertisement strategies, yet abide by the guidelines and standards we outline periodically via our Manual or other written resources. We will provide you access to pre-approved advertising materials, such as signs, posters, collateral, etc., that we have developed. We retain the authority to finalize all creative aspects of advertising and promotional content development. Any proposed advertisement or promotional materials, plans, or designs not approved by us within the previous year must be submitted to us in writing for our review before implementation. If approval is not received within 10 business days following receipt of the material, it shall be deemed as disapproval. We retain the prerogative to mandate you cease the utilization of any advertising or marketing materials at any given time.

original: 10.3 Ownership of Data . original: 11. OPERATING MANUAL We will furnish you with one copy of, or electronic access to, the Manual, on loan, for as long as this Agreement or a Successor Franchise Agreement remains in effect. 11. ACCESS TO OPERATING MANUAL: Upon the commencement and continuation of this Agreement or any subsequent Franchise Agreement, we shall grant you temporary access to a single copy of the Manual, or electronic access, which shall be subject to our terms and conditions for restricted areas of our website. We retain exclusive ownership of the copyright for the Manual, and consider it confidential property.

You acknowledge and agree that the provided Manual, training materials, and any other manuals or materials related to the System must be treated with utmost discretion as confidential information. Furthermore, you agree not to disclose any confidential information or materials that we provide to unauthorized individuals. We reserve the right to modify and update the Manual at our discretion, through various means such as letters, emails, bulletins, videos, audiotapes, software, or other communication methods. It is your responsibility to maintain an updated version of the Manual and comply with any new or amended standards upon notification from us.

In case of a dispute regarding the contents of the Manual, our copy stored at our headquarters shall take precedence. However, we encourage open dialogue and mutual understanding in the event of questions or concerns related to the Manual's content.

original: Page 28 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015 14.7. Non-Conforming Transfers . Any purported Transfer that is not in compliance with this Section 14 is null and void and constitutes a material breach of this Agreement, for which we may terminate this Agreement without opportunity to cure. Our consent to a Transfer does not constitute a waiver of any claims that we have against the transferor, nor is it a waiver of our right to demand exact compliance with the terms of this Agreement.
modified:
14.7. Permissible Transfers . Any transfer made in contravention to this Section 14 shall be deemed ineffective and considered a material breach of this Agreement, prompting us to have the right to terminate this Agreement immediately, without any provision for remedy or correction. Granting our consent to a transfer does not imply forgiveness of any claims we hold against the transferee, nor does it relinquish our prerogative to insist upon strict adherence to the terms of this Agreement.

In this revised clause, the original clause's obligation for compliance with Section 14 has been weakened as any non-compliant transfer is now considered invalid immediately and termination of the agreement can occur without opportunity for correction or remedy. Additionally, the clause now places more responsibility on the party receiving the transfer (the transferee), stating that our consent does not imply forgiveness of claims against them and we retain the right to demand strict adherence to the terms of the agreement.

original: 15.2.15 . You cease to operate the Franchised Business for more than seven (7) consecutive days or fourteen (14) days in any calendar year unless we approved a temporary closing or we determine, that the failure to operate was beyond your control, you otherwise abandon the Franchised Business, or you lose the right to possess the Premises or you otherwise forfeit the right to do or transact business as required under this Agreement. If, however, through no fault of you, the Premises are damaged or destroyed by an event such that repairs or reconstruction cannot be completed within ninety (90) days thereafter, you will have thirty (30) days after such event in which to apply for our approval to relocate and/or reconstruct the premises, and we will not unreasonably hold our approval.
ollama_generated: 15.2.15 . We grant you the discretion to temporarily cease operating the Franchised Business for more than seven (7) consecutive days or fourteen (14) days in any calendar year, without prior approval from us, provided that such closure is not deemed an abandonment of the Franchise Business and does not result in the loss of your right to possess the Premises or forfeit the right to do business as required under this Agreement. However, if, through no fault of yours, the Premises are damaged or destroyed by an event that requires repairs or reconstruction beyond ninety (90) days, you must notify us within thirty (30) days after such event and we shall not unreasonably withhold our approval for a reasonable time to relocate and/or reconstruct the premises.

original: Page 30 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015 15.3. Termination by Us Following Expiration of Cure Period for Monetary Default . You will be in default under this Agreement if you fail, refuse, or neglect to pay when due (including if we are not able to collect payments by electronic fund transfer pursuant to Section 3.6  [Method of Payment]  due to insufficient funds in your account(s), closure of your account(s), or any other reason resulting in the nonpayment) any monies owing to us, our affiliates, or any lender that has provided financing to you under this Agreement or any other agreement, or to your landlord and/or any supplier of goods or services to your Franchised Business. You will have ten (10) days after written notice of such default from us within which to remedy the default. You may avoid termination by curing the default to our satisfaction within the 10-day period (or such longer period as applicable law may require). If you do not cure the default within such 10-day period (or such longer period as applicable law may require), this Agreement will terminate automatically and without further notice, effective immediately upon the expiration of the specified time period.

15.3. Termination by Us Following Expiration of Grace Period for Monetary Default. A breach of this Agreement will occur if we are unable to receive payment as required (whether due to insufficient funds in your account(s), closure of your account(s), or any other reason that prevents payment) regarding the money you owe us, our affiliates, lenders who have financed you under this Agreement or any other agreement, or your landlord and/or suppliers of goods or services for your Franchised Business. Once we provide written notice of such breach, you will be granted a grace period of ten (10) days to rectify the situation. If you successfully remedy the breach within this grace period (or any extended period required by law), termination of this Agreement will not occur. However, if you fail to correct the breach within the specified time, this Agreement shall be deemed terminated automatically, effective immediately upon the expiration of the grace period.

original: 15.4 Termination by Us Following Expiration of Cure Period . You may avoid termination by curing the default to our satisfaction within the 30-day period (or such longer period as applicable law may require). original: 16.5.2 The amounts contemplated under Section 16.4  [Liquidated Damages]  above is not a penalty and is intended by the parties only as a compensatory remedy for past breaches and not as a preventative remedy to deter future breaches. The amount detailed in Section 16.4 [Liquidated Damages] is not payment for the privilege of non-performance; rather, it is separate from any alternative methods of compliance. Given this, as a purely liquidated damage provision, this section does not prohibit, nor contradict, a court granting us an injunction or other remedial actions, such as specific performance, to prevent future breaches. The exercise of our rights to liquidated damages and the pursuit of specific performance or any other equitable relief are not mutually exclusive.

original: 17.2. After Termination, Expiration, or Transfer . For two (2) years after the expiration or termination of this Agreement or an approved Transfer to a new franchisee, you may not directly or indirectly own, manage, engage in, be employed by, advise, make loans to, consult for, or have any other interest in any Competitive Business that is, or intends to operate, within three (3) mile radius of the Premises of your Franchised Business or within a three (3) mile radius of any Restaurant then-operating or under construction to operate under the System, except as permitted by any Franchise Agreements that remain in effect between you and us. .
modified: 17.2. Upon Termination, Expiration, or Transfer: For a period of two (2) years following the expiry or termination of this Agreement or an approved transfer to a new franchisee, you are not prohibited from owning, managing, engaging in, being employed by, advising, making loans to, consulting for, or having any other interest in any Competitive Business. However, such activities are restricted only if they occur within a three (3) mile radius of the Premises of your former Franchised Business, or within a three (3) mile radius of any Restaurant that is currently operating under the System, or has plans to operate under the System, at the time of such activity. This restriction does not apply if you have other active and valid Franchise Agreements with us that remain in effect during this period.

original: 17.3. Owners and Employees . The Owners agree that they will personally bind themselves to this Section 17 by signing this Agreement or the attached Guaranty. With respect to the Owners, the time period in Section 17.2  [After Termination, Expiration, or Transfer]  will run from the expiration, termination, or Transfer of this Agreement or from the termination of the Owner’s relationship with you, whichever occurs first. You must also require and obtain execution of covenants similar to those set forth in Section 12 above, and this Section 17 (as modified to apply to an individual), from any or all of the following persons: your officers, directors, and their respective spouses and employees. (These persons and the Owners are each a “ Restricted Party ”) The covenants required by this Section 17.3  [Owners and Employees]  shall be in the form provided in Appendix C to this Agreement. Failure by Franchisee to obtain execution of a covenant required by this Section 17.3  [Owners and Employees] shall constitute a default under Section 15.2.13  [Termination By Us Without A Cure Period]  above.
modified:
17.3. Owners and Employees Obligations: The Parties acknowledge that the Franchisee's officers, directors, and their respective spouses, as well as employees (collectively referred to as "Restricted Parties"), are bound by this Section 17 upon the execution of this Agreement or its attached Guaranty. Regarding the Restricted Parties, the time period specified in Section 17.2 [During the Agreement's Term] will commence from the date of this Agreement and persist until the termination of their relationship with the Franchisor, or if later, the expiration or transfer of this Agreement.

It is incumbent upon you to secure and record agreements that mirror the commitments outlined in Section 12 above, specifically tailored for individual Restricted Parties, as required by this Section 17.3 [Owners and Employees Obligations]. (These agreements shall be referred to as "Individual Covenants" and will follow the format provided in Appendix C of this Agreement.)

The failure of the Franchisee to obtain and record such Individual Covenants, as required by this Section 17.3 [Owners and Employees Obligations], shall not constitute a default under Section 15.2.13 [Termination With A Cure Period] above. Instead, it will serve as notice to the Franchisee of the need for prompt remedial action to avoid potential defaults in the future.

original: 20.2. Waivers . No delay or failure to exercise any right under this Agreement or to insist upon your strict compliance with any obligation or condition, and no custom or practice that differs from the terms of this Agreement, will constitute a waiver of our right to exercise the contract provision or to demand your strict compliance with the terms of this Agreement. Our waiver of any particular default does not affect or impair our rights with respect to any subsequent default you may commit. Our waiver of a default by another franchisee does not affect or impair our right to demand your strict compliance with the terms of this Agreement. Our acceptance of any payments due from you does not waive any prior defaults.
ollama_generated:
20.2. Waivers . Any forbearance or neglect by us to enforce any provision of this Agreement, any tolerance we may exhibit in dealing with your non-compliance with any obligation or condition, and any variation from the terms of this Agreement that might arise through custom or practice, will not be construed as a concession or relinquishment of our right to enforce the contractual provisions or to require strict compliance by you with all terms of this Agreement. Any remission of past breaches does not alter or affect our ability to act upon any future breaches on your part. Likewise, our leniency towards another franchisee's non-compliance will not lessen our right to enforce your strict adherence to the terms of this Agreement. Our acceptance of payments due from you shall not be deemed as a waiver of any previous defaults.

The purpose of this revised clause is to maintain the legal rigor and professional tone while slightly emphasizing that any leniency or forbearance will not affect our future ability to enforce compliance with the agreement terms, and that our acceptance of payments does not affect our rights to pursue action on past breaches.

original: 22. ENTIRE AGREEMENT AND AMENDMENTS This Agreement and the documents referred to herein constitute the entire agreement between you and us with respect to the Franchised Business and supersede all prior negotiations, representations, correspondence, and agreements concerning the same subject matter. However, nothing in this Agreement is meant to disclaim any representation that we make in the Franchise Disclosure Document that we have given to you.
modified: 22. LIMITATIONS ON AGREEMENT AND AMENDMENTS: This Agreement, along with any accompanying documents, represents the full extent of our understanding regarding the Franchised Business. It supersedes all previous discussions, promises, communications, and agreements pertaining to the same subject matter, except for any representations we've made in the Franchise Disclosure Document provided to you. We wish to emphasize that this Agreement does not limit or waive any such representations contained within the Franchise Disclosure Document.

original: 23.5 No Third Party Rights . Except as otherwise stated in this Agreement, nothing in this Agreement is intended (nor shall be deemed) to confer upon any party any rights or remedies under or by reason of this Agreement, except for you, us, and such of our respective successors and assigns as may be contemplated (and, as to you, permitted) by Sections 13 and 14 above.
ollama_generated: 23.5 Third-Party Rights Limitations: It is explicitly stated that this Agreement grants no rights or remedies to any third party, except for the following scenarios: (i) instances specified within this Agreement, or (ii) in accordance with Sections 13 and 14, where such rights are granted to your successors or assigns, and, uniquely for you, as allowed under these aforementioned sections. It is crucial to note that any other interpretation of this Agreement not mentioned herein shall not be deemed to confer third-party rights.

original: 25.2. Forum for Litigation. You and the Owners must file any suit against us, and we may file any suit against you, in the federal or state court where our principal office is located at the time the suit is filed. The parties waive all questions of personal jurisdiction and venue for the purpose of carrying out this provision.
ollama_generated: 25.2. Jurisdictional Provisions. In the event that either party wishes to instigate legal action against the other, they retain the right to do so; however, any such suit filed by us shall be permissible only in the federal or state court where our principal office is currently situated at the time the lawsuit is initiated. You, as well as ourselves, relinquish any challenges regarding personal jurisdiction and venue, thereby consenting to this agreement's execution within the specified courts.

original: Page 36 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015 25.3. Mutual Waiver of Class Actions . Any lawsuit, claim, counterclaim, or other action may be conducted only on an individual basis, and not as part of a consolidated, common, or class action.
modified:
Page 36 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015

25.3. Right to Class Actions . Any party retains the right to pursue or defend a lawsuit, claim, counterclaim, or other action, which may be conducted collectively as part of a consolidated, common, or class action, at their sole discretion.

original: 26.2. Receipt of Documents. You acknowledge that you received a copy of this Agreement, the exhibit(s) hereto, and agreements relating hereto, if any, with all of the blank lines therein filled in, at least seven (7) days before the date when this Agreement was signed, and with sufficient time within which to review the Agreement, with advisors of your choosing. You further acknowledge that you received our franchise disclosure document required by the Federal Trade Commission’s Franchise Rule at least fourteen (14) days before the date this Agreement was signed.
ollama_generated: 26.2. Transmission of Documents: We affirm that we shall provide you with a copy of this Agreement, the attached exhibits, and any related documents, with all blank spaces filled in, at least seven (7) business days prior to the execution date. You shall have the opportunity to review the Agreement during this timeframe, but the onus is on you to seek advice from legal advisors of your preference. Additionally, we guarantee that our franchise disclosure document as mandated by the Federal Trade Commission’s Franchise Rule will be delivered to you at least fourteen (14) days prior to the effective date of this Agreement. The responsibility for understanding the contents lies solely with you.

original: 26.6. No Conflicting Obligations . Each party represents and warrants to the others that there are no other agreements, court orders, or any other legal obligations that would preclude or in any manner restrict such party from: (a) negotiating and entering into this Agreement; (b) exercising its rights under this Agreement; and/or (c) fulfilling its responsibilities under this Agreement.
modified: 26.6. Potential Conflicting Obligations . Each party acknowledges the possibility of other agreements, court orders, or legal obligations that may potentially interfere with such party's ability to: (a) engage in negotiations and execute this Agreement; (b) exercise its rights or remedies under this Agreement; and/or (c) perform its duties as specified in this Agreement. It is understood that any such conflicting obligations shall be disclosed promptly to the other parties, and the parties shall work collaboratively to address and resolve any conflicts that may arise.

original: 3. Site Selection Area (if applicable):
ollama_generated:
3. Potential Site Selection Area (where applicable):

If any area requiring selection arises during the course of this agreement, the Contractor shall have the discretion to choose the site, subject to the approval of the Client. The Client acknowledges and accepts that the selected site may not meet their initial preferences or expectations and releases the Contractor from any liability for such discrepancies. The Client further agrees to bear all costs associated with the change of site selection should it be necessary.
